intro: Malesherbia rosulata, commonly known as the Rosulate Malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking rosette-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticultural enthusiasts.
